content.description: Identify the pitch pattern that is played. You will have ten seconds to read the choices, and then you will hear the musical example played twice, with a brief pause between the playings.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: C4, D4, E-flat4, F4, G4, A4, B4, C5
C4, D4, E-flat4, F4, G4, A-flat4, B4, C5
C4, D4, E-flat4, F4, G4, A-flat4, B-flat4, C5

content.answer: C4, D4, E-flat4, F4, G4, A4, B4, C5

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

topic.text: 2.1: Minor Scales - Natural, Harmonic, and Melodic

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
